page.title: 14DAVID VEREY
page.content: David Verey was an architect and a member of an important local family. He was high sherriff of the county in 1966 and was chairman of the Gloucester Diocesan Advisory Committee on facilities and the care of churches. He published a book on Gloucestershire in the 'Buildings of England' series and wrote several of the shell Guides to the counties of England.He also wrote a book called 'Cotswold Churches'. He lived at Barnsley House in the village, which was the old rectory from 1792-1932 but was built in 1697. The gardens are very beautiful and are open to the public. Mrs Verey runs a garden centre there and her son designs and makes garden furniture.
